articles.title: PMO and CBSA say they weren’t part of Kneecap entry ban announcement
articles.description: The Prime Minister's Office and the Canada Border Services Agency say they weren't 'involved' or 'consulted' in an announcement of an apparent entry ban on the Irish group Kneecap.

articles.title: Altman describes OpenAI’s forthcoming AI device as more peaceful and calm than the iPhone
articles.description: Altman and Ive tease a simple AI device aimed at calm, distraction-free computing, launching within two years.

articles.title: Ten affordable housing projects greenlit for surplus Edmonton school grounds
articles.description: Bankrolled by $99 million from the federal Housing Acceleration Fund, city sells 10 surplus school grounds to developers for one dollar each

articles.title: One dead after fire at central Edmonton apartment building
articles.description: One person was found dead after an early morning apartment fire in central Edmonton on Monday. Edmonton Fire Rescue Services received reports of a multi-residential structure fire near 118 Street and 102 Avenue. Crews arrived on scene at 2:22 a.m. at an apartment building with alarms ringing and res

articles.title: Edmonton moves forward with plan to build affordable housing on land once intended for schools
articles.description: Affordable housing developers in Edmonton have been selected to build homes on land that was originally intended for schools several decades ago. The City of Edmonton says 10 sites were selected at former surplus school sites, which were reserved to have schools built between the 1970s and ’90

articles.title: Senior cyclist, 65, dead after collision with SUV in southeast Edmonton
articles.description: This marks the 31st traffic fatality in Edmonton this year

articles.title: OpenAI learned the hard way that Cameo trademarked the word ‘cameo’
articles.description: OpenAI might have to rename the "cameo" feature in the Sora app.

articles.title: How I found the drones flying through downtown Ottawa
articles.description: Drones will fly on Kent, Queen and Sparks and Wellington streets between Nov. 24-28 as part of the DND detection trial.

articles.title: OpenTable names Carleton Place restaurant among best 100 in Canada
articles.description: "A lot of our regulars were like, ‘Hey, congrats, we’ve known it all along — now everybody knows,'" said chef-owner Ian Carswell.

articles.title: Alberta seeks to change existing drug coverage, allow physicians to work in public and private sectors

articles.title: Rad Power Bikes’ batteries receive major fire risk warning
articles.description: The U.S Consumer Product Safety Commission claims Rad Power "refused to agree to an acceptable recall." Rad Power says the CPSC's solution would bankrupt the company.

articles.title: Tesla FSD software may not be approved by EU regulator after all
articles.description: Tesla claimed in a weekend social media post that a Dutch regulator was set to approve its Full Self-Driving mode. It seems the regulator isn't quite in line with Tesla.
